data.description:
Travel to Riven, a beautiful and mysterious world on the verge of collapse. Explore this mysterious place, solve its puzzles, reveal its mysteries, make a daring rescue, and escape.

**VISIT A MYSTERIOUS WORLD**

Riven takes you on a journey through dense jungles, awe-inspiring caverns, and monolithic structures. Explore a world bent to the whims of a man who sees himself as a god and where every corner will immerse you in an otherworldly adventure.

**IMMERSE YOURSELF IN A SURREAL LANDSCAPE**

Challenge Riven’s cunning puzzles, deftly woven throughout its narrative. The environment of Riven will reveal the story of this world as you make meaning from seemingly disparate bits of information and learn everything you need to know about this world.

**UNRAVEL RIVEN’S SECRETS**

Who are the mysterious island dwellers you encounter during your exploration? What purpose does the giant golden dome serve? Why is this world on the verge of collapse? Play Riven and discover the answers to these mysteries- and more.

**ABOUT THIS REMAKE**

Created by the legendary indie developer Cyan Worlds and based on the smash-hit original released in 1997, Riven has been lovingly revisited by its key original visionaries to expand the epic narrative of the Myst universe.

This brand-new, re-imagined, and expanded version of Riven offers a deeper story, new captivating visuals, and a journey that stays true to the original release while also expanding on Riven’s breathtaking world.

Quest Patch 1.3.0 notes - July 31st, 2024

We have a new patch for you, patch 1.3.0 with version number e3984-p26366.

You can find the build number above in the Options → Help section of the menu.

Fixes/changes made a part of this new build on July 31st

General
- Various sound fixes implemented
- Almost 1000 art fixes and polish implemented
- Various performance improvements implemented
- Lighting fixes implemented
- Animation improvements implemented
- (Spoiler) The bridge in the Starry Expanse that leads to the Temple Island PMD is now permanently extended
- Screenshots in your notebook will now be listed in the order of newest to oldest
- Screenshots in your notebook are now limited to 150 total

Major
- Fixed an issue where taking too many screenshots would result in a gradual degradation of texture quality that could persist across game sessions
- Fixed an issue where the maglev could return to Temple Island backwards
- Fixed an issue with the controller diagram 
- Fixed a persistence issue with the D’ni counting toy
- Fixed an issue where the player position could break during the trap book endings
- Fixed an issue where a page in a journal could get locked in the middle of it while opened
- (SPOILER) Fixed an issue with the Starry Expanse sometimes appearing unloaded when a PMD opens on Quest devices with degraded storage volumes
- Fixed a crash that could occur with a particular arrangement of a puzzle on Survey Island
- (SPOILER) Fixed an issue with the telescope code page not appearing localized
- Fixed being able to save/load on the tracks in the minecart cave and getting stuck underwater in specific circumstances
- (SPOILER) Fixed getting caught on the fire marble tray when it rises
- Fixed collision to prevent getting stuck on the path to the spider room chair
- Added additional safeguards for a crash that could happen under rare circumstances when traversing on the submarine
- (SPOILER) Fix for being able to climb a ladder you shouldn’t have been able to in the Starry Expanse under specific circumstances, which led to the player becoming stuck

Minor
- Fixed an issue with Gehn’s speech volume in one of the endings
- Fixed an issue where the maglev dashboard became low res 
- Fixed areas where the blackout screen wasn’t implemented and you could stick your head through terrain
- Fixed the brightness on the underground aquarium viewers on Survey Island
- Fixed the brightness for the totem eyepiece wedges 
- Fixed a collision issue with one of the planks in Prison Island 
- Fixed an issue where scrolling up/down in the menus rotated the player too easily 
- Fixed some animation issues with the imagers in Gehn’s room 
- Added a sound effect to the pickaxe in Boiler Island
- Added a hand gesture when using the trap book 
- Fixed an alignment issue with the fog between Temple and Boiler Island 
- Fixed an issue where double gripping a grabbable item would cause it to break the animation 
- Implemented satchel behavior improvements when brought out near walls 
- Fixed an issue where holding the fire marble from the geode could affect player movement 
- Fix for "The first step is not always simple" achievement sometimes not firing off 
- Fixed an issue where teleport nodes were slightly below the floor around Temple Island 
- Fixed an issue where sometimes you couldn’t save the game in the dark jungle on Jungle Island 
- Fixed a persistence issue with the drawers in Gehn’s lab on Boiler Island 
- Fixed an issue where the top of the cut geode in Gehn’s lab would reset back onto the desk after you threw it away 
- Fixed an issue where subtitles didn’t appear for part of the good ending 
- Fixed a German translation error for the D’ni proverb after starting a new game
- Fixed an issue with the wahrk sightings playing too frequently on Survey Island
- Fixed an issue where Catherine would be in her cell via the Survey Island viewer, even after you freed her. She finally remembered where she put her car keys!
- Fixed an issue with Gehn’s journal updating to describe the Temple - Boiler bridge collapse after capturing Gehn
- Fixed an issue with the waffle iron elevator remaining in its raised position when linking to Boiler Island from Age 233
- (SPOILER) Fixed an achievement issue where you didn’t actually have to look down at Gehn’s guard to get the “Cho?” achievement 
- Fixed being able to leave the waffle iron puzzle with a charged powermarble 
- Fixed a persistence issue with the sunners reappearing too early
- (SPOILER) Fixed being able to move the stone slab that blocks the entrance to the Tay linking room overtop of the user 
- Fixed some collision issues around the wahrk trapeze elevator in Jungle Island
- Fixed steam rising from the wahrk effigy waterhole while the waterhole was closed
- Earthquake sound fixed for the ending
- (SPOILER) Fixed being able to overwater the beetle tree
- (SPOILER) Removed a fade that would occur when you reached a certain part of Tay

e3984-p26366 OSS: Oculus -- Jenkins build 1344

e3550-p25334 OSS: Oculus -- Jenkins build 1231

Major
- Implemented a glitchy linking book in Age 233.
- Fixed some characters appearing invisible if you watch a scene where they link out, then load a save or continue the game from where they should not be linked out anymore.
- Fixed potential performance slowdown if you left the game open overnight or played for a long time.
- Fixed a block that could occur if you loaded a save made inside of the cell in the hive in Tay.
- Fixed a block that could occur where the camera wouldn’t fade back in on certain ladders in VR.
- Fixed issue where Catherine might not appear after you complete a major milestone (get the trap book, trap Gehn, received the access code) based on whether or not you had visited her before.
- Fixed an issue where you could not re-read a book once read all the way through.
- Fixed an issue with the trap book disappearing during a sequence when it should not.

Minor
- Improved the appearance of many characters in the game.
- Improved some animations of characters in the game.
- Fixed some animations where Gehn goes to turn on an already-on stove.
- Gehn will now walk in and out of the room from outside.
- Improved the appearance of the stroboscopes.
- Improved the environment in 233.
- Improved audio occlusion in some areas.
- Modified some visibility regions to make some areas visible sooner.
- Fixed the page flipping animation in one of Gehn’s journals being too fast.
- Fixed missing cap in some of the rock formations in the mining cave on Boiler Island.
- Added an enlarged cracked rock at the Jungle to Temple maglev dock.
- Improved the Warhk Effigy textures.
- Added a sizzling “flyer” in Age 233.
- Fixed holes in some islands when riding between Jungle and Temple.
- Adjusted the angle of the water tower pulley so you can see the stream of water in front of the mechanisms more clearly.
- Improved the appearance of the Impostor meshes of the Jungle Village area when viewing it from the “bone throne” above the basin.
- Added some lava to certain areas in Survey and Jungle.
- Added a trap book panel material that is shown while you are in the trap book.
- Fixed some users being able to peer around to see Gehn’s man frozen in space before he begins his initial animation on Temple Island.
- Fixed Catherine’s Survey Island videos showing her clipping through objects sometimes.
- Updated the telescope brass and the brass in the entry cage to use the same brass material for consistency.
- Updated the book used by some characters in the end-game to use the correct K’veer linking book.
- Updated the way the call buttons in Catherine’s prison work.
- Fix for the moiety dagger disappearing in the lever on Temple Island once you leave and return.
- Improved audio for two of the endings.
- Fix for the water globe in the lab on Boiler Island initializing in an incorrect state.
- Powermarbles will now be higher fidelity at a reasonable distance.
- Adjusted the Temple Island end-game sequences to not show the loading icon during the level transition.
- Fixed the last page of Gehn’s lab journal not being translated in Russian.
- Fixed the first page of Catherine’s journal being rotated incorrectly in Simplified Chinese.
- Made the timing of Gehn’s sound piece in Age 233 a little more forgiving.
- Fixed some typos in D’ni script in the gate room on Temple Island.
- Various collision fixes.
- Adjusted the attenuation of earthquakes in the game.
- Added more auto-close triggers for PMDs around the game, namely for Boiler Island and Survey Island.
- Added a shrine to Catherine in Tay.
- Updated the appearance of the beetles in the gate room.
- Fixed the sunners not disappearing at the end of their swim away animation.
- Fixed a visual “pop” that could occur when entering a trap book sequence.
- Added some bleed-through elements to specific pages in Catherine’s journal.
- Adjusted the smoke coming from Gehn’s pipe.
- The guards in Tay now animate.
- Adjusted timing on sounds during trap book sequences.
